Uses the minimal number of bits to encode a state machine.
Encodes the state machine in the manner specified by user.

Synthesis process is streamlined to improve the runtime at the cost of design performance and/or resource usage. Use this option when the FItter early_timing_estimate mode is used or when fast-synthesis compilation is needed whitout the need to run the Fitter. When this option is used with the regular Fitter, Fitter performance may decrease as fast-synthesis netlists take longer to route.
Makes the design as small as possible in order to minimize resource usage.
Chooses a design implementation that has the fastest fmax.
Chooses a design implementation that has a high-speed performance with minimal logic usage.

tool.name: QuartusSynthesis
tool.label: Load Source files to Quartus and Synthesize

parameter.label: Analysis and elaboration
parameter.tooltip: Option to check all the design files in a design for syntax and semantec errors, and perform a netlist exraction.

parameter.label: Synthesis effort
parameter.tooltip: Option to select synthesis effort level

parameter.label: Device family
parameter.tooltip: Option to target the specified device family. The family name should not contain any spaces. If you need to add space between words in the family name, make sure that you enclose the family name in double quotation marks.

parameter.label: Ignore CARRY_SUM buffers
parameter.tooltip: Ignore CARRY_SUM buffers that are instantiated in the design.

parameter.label: Ignore CASCADE buffers
parameter.tooltip: Ignore CASCADE buffers that are instantiated in the design.

parameter.label: Incremental compilation
parameter.tooltip: Option to specify the incremental compilation mode.

parameter.label: Lower priority
parameter.tooltip: Option to lower priority of the current process.

parameter.label: Optimize design
parameter.tooltip: Option to optimeze the design to achieve maximum speed performance, minimum area usage or high speed performance with minimal area cost during synthesis.

parameter.label: # of processors to use
parameter.tooltip: Controls parallel compilation. If 0 is specified, the Quartus software uses all processors detected on the system. Otherwise, the software attempts to use the specified number of processors. Note: this feature is not licenced for the Web Edition and this parameter should be set to 1

parameter.label: Part (see Project)
parameter.tooltip: Altera device to use (configured in 'project' dialog)

parameter.label: Design top module
parameter.tooltip: Top module of the design, determined by the project top file

parameter.label: Constraints files
parameter.tooltip: Select constraint files to load to Quartus

parameter.label: Create snapshot
parameter.tooltip: Automatically create snapshot after successful synthesis

parameter.label: Reset project
parameter.tooltip: Reset project before loading source files

parameter.label: Skip pre-synthesis
parameter.tooltip: Do not run pre-synthesis TCL commands

parameter.label: Pre-synthesis TCL commands
parameter.tooltip: TCL commands to run before synthesis
